Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tissue Adhesive in Bilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 30 patients undergoing simultaneous bilateral TKA.

Intervention.evidence: The left knee was randomised to receive either standard three-layer closure with staples or the same closure supplemented with tissue adhesive.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effect of high-viscosity tissue adhesive on postoperative wound drainage and healing in a fast-track TKA setting.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the number of dressing changes in the first 72 hours postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The left knee was randomised to receive either standard three-layer closure with staples or the same closure supplemented with tissue adhesive.

Blinding.evidence: Nurses changing dressings were blinded to treatment allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 30 patients undergoing simultaneous bilateral TKA.

Number_Analysed.evidence: One patient was excluded, leaving 29 patients (58 knees) for analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Knees with tissue adhesive had fewer dressing changes (median, 0; IQR, 0-1) compared to the control (IQR, 1-2; p = 0.001).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details are not provided.
